metadata.Title: CVE-2022-2867 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - low.
metadata.Description:
libtiff's tiffcrop utility has a uint32_t underflow that can lead to out of bounds read and write. An attacker who supplies a crafted file to tiffcrop (likely via tricking a user to run tiffcrop on it with certain parameters) could cause a crash or in some cases, further exploitation.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-2867` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libtiff-opengl - 4.1.0+git191117-2ubuntu0.20.04.6
libtiff-tools - 4.1.0+git191117-2ubuntu0.20.04.6
libtiff5 - 4.1.0+git191117-2ubuntu0.20.04.6
libtiffxx5 - 4.1.0+git191117-2ubuntu0.20.04.6
No subscription required

notes.Note: rodrigo-zaiden> fix is the same commit as in CVE-2022-2868, CVE-2022-2869

criterions.comment: tiff package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.1.0+git191117-2ubuntu0.20.04.6').
